name: Red Lion Hotel & Casino

reviews.text: I just returned from a Casino Express trip to Elko, Nevada from Wichita Falls, Texas. I had never been before and knew nothing about Elko, the Red Lion or Casino Express. After seeing the ad in the local paper, I read the reviews on this site and finding them to be mostly favorable, a friend and I decided to give it a shot.
reviews.title: A fun little gambling get-a-way!
loved the hotel/casino/food/area services
reviews.text: Overall, we both agree that we had a great time. Was it the best vacation we ever had? No. However, we had a lot of fun and for the price (under $300 total for airfare and three nights hotel for the two of us) it's hard to beat. Since previous traveler's reviews were so helpful for me, I write to assist others who may also be considering a trip.

reviews.title: a never again vacation
reviews.text: The Red Lion Inn and it's sister property across the street, the Best Western Gold Country Inn, are both owned by the same folks who own Casino Express. They offer extremely reasonable three and four day getaways at dirt cheap prices in hopes of people gambling lots of money at their casinos in the hotels. I will summarize each part of the deal, both good and bad, as my friend and I saw it.

reviews.title: For the Gaming and Dining in Elko; Red Lion Hotel and Casino
reviews.text: Casino Express.

reviews.title: Great stay
reviews.text: The planes themselves are older 737's. They are clean enough, but the seats are a bit cramped and the overhead bins are pretty small. Our flight was only about 2/3 full, so my friend and I were the only two on our three seat row which made the 2 1/2 hour flight a little more bearable. The food and beverage service was limited, but about the same as coach service on any standard airline. On the return flight, the airport in Elko was shut down by fog and after several hours spent waiting at the hotel/casino, we were finally bussed out on a 2 1/2 hour ride to Twin Falls, Idaho where we waited another couple of hours for a plane to be sent to pick us up and bring us home. Although the 10 hour delay getting home caused some inconveniences, our group was given a complimentary lunch at the hotel restaurant while we waited for the bus to take us to Idaho and drinks were comped on the flight home. Given that the weather delays were beyond their control, I feel the airline handled it as best they reasonably could.

reviews.title: great place to go
reviews.text: I live in elko the first thing you notice on the eastern elko city limits is the great big red lion inn & casino sign it glows day and night. Red lion is easy to access just folow elko tell you see a exit called ELKO EAST. The red lion is near some great food places,and some stores like albertsons. pizza barn is a good place to buy pizza from elko. gold country inn is a great place to eat to. they also have a big casino with lots of service. if the place got robbed the person would get caught real fast. the rooms are very well secure. If you wana see some statues of horses just drive through the main gate. When you exit notice how many gas stations there are. actualy the person whome owns red lion put a gas station near the inn. the aprox. 1/4 mile long building and 3 stories is a great place they got a swimming pool aswell. some balconies so you can go out and get some fresh air in your room on the 3rd floor.

reviews.title: Great Escape
reviews.text: I just recently returned from a 4 day trip to Elko NV with a group from our home town of Woodward OK. Ths was my first time there and I will definitely return. The hotel was very nice, service was excellent. I would highly recommend this for a vacation to others. This is a small town, but it has alot to offer.

reviews.title: Red Lion, a place to enjoy!
reviews.text: I just came back from Elko, departing from Laredo, Texas and believe me I´m coming back in February. Elko is a charming and quiet town that invites you to rest and enjoy the casinos. Red Lion is an excellent hotel, everything is good: the rooms, the food but mainly the people working there, always willing to help you and cooperate to make your stay a wonderful time!!!Gabriela Elizondo Monterrey, México

reviews.title: Red Lion a good choice
reviews.text: I just returned from a 3-day business trip to Elko and stayed at the Red Lion. The rate was good ($65/night weekend) and the rooms were average or slightly above. The rooms included a coffee maker, iron and ironing board, and balcony (!).The casino was quite unkind to me, though its quality was decent enough. Not a whole lot of brand new machines, though the money train penny machines (linked to progressive jackpots which are randomly awarded) were fun. The blackjack tables were always available. Disappointing, though, was the fact that the poker room and often the roulette wheel were not open during the day. Also, the craps table was seemingly open at all times, though almost no one played. Since craps is my favorite game, that was very disappointing, as your money goes awfully quick when you're the only one at the table. They also have a very adequate sports book, with a good number of high-quality screens, and a keno lounge.The restaurant, Coffee Garden, was above-average for food quality. The buffet is a good value and the menu items are not too shabby either. The service was hit-or-miss, sometimes great, sometimes lacking.If the Ruby Mountains are factored in, the Elko area really has a lot to offer. The Lamoille Canyon road is one of the best scenic mountain roads I have ever seen. Bighorn sheep and mountain goats are not uncommon sights. Also, I recommend the Northeastern Nevada Museum highly. They have an animal display that is second to none - showing wild animals from all over the world.

reviews.title: Awesome 1st Wedding Anniversary
reviews.text: We wanted to go somewhere special for our 1st Wedding Anniversay and we were told about Elko. We had an awesome time, the gambling is good, we did not come home with millions but we had fun, the food is to die for and the rooms are excellent, not to mention the service and the friendly residents of Elko, it felt like home. We are planning on going back in the Summer, my husband wants to take a tour of the local ranches. We recommend you go and visit Elko!!!!! Ramiro & Mary Lou from Texas

reviews.title: never again
reviews.text: i was never so disappointed in any trip.
the help at red lion inn are unfriendly,& lazy
reviews.title: Red Lion staff very friendly

reviews.text: i will never go there again.
reviews.title: Elko Red Lion Inn Is a Dump

reviews.text: you wait 30 minutes to get paid on a winning game.
reviews.title: Very suprised there are good reviews, it was awful!

reviews.text: WE just returned from a Casino Express trip from Toledo Ohio to Elko, Nevada and stayed at the Red Lion. This was our second trip to Elko with Casino Express. The only major complaint I have is that they don't do seat assignments. We almost had a fist fight on the flight back because a group traveling together thought they should have had preferential treatment and had assigned seats. It didn't help that the airport had am employee who was giving out information on the flight and didn't really know what he was talking about. First he gave instructions to take the same seat you had on the incoming flight and in the next breath was telling everyone that it was open seating on the flight. He should have stated one or the other. The staff in the hotel, casino and restaurants at Red Lion were all very friendly. The rooms are nice and well kept. I do think the food is better at Gold County, which is across the street from the Red Lion. Overall, the package offered by Casino Express is a real deal and we plan to go back. I just hope they get a little more organized with the flights. WE will plan to stay the Red Lion again.
reviews.title: great value but be careful

reviews.text: When my husband made the reservation to stay here, I was a bit hesitant - especially after reading some of the prior reviews. However, I am very happy to say that we enjoyed our stay very much. They are currently remodeling and upgrading their rooms. We were in one of those rooms. It was comfortable, clean, quiet and there was no smell of smoke (very nice because it was a non-smoking room). The bed was very comfortable with a nice comforter and a light blanket. And there was a comfortable sitting chair. The bathroom was very clean, plenty of towels and shampoo, etc. (nice quality from Bath & Body Works),
reviews.title: A very pleasant surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate twice at their "fine dining" restaurant, Misty's, and were very happy both nights with our dinner. The staff were friendly and helpful. Again, an enjoyable, relaxing dinner both nights.
reviews.title: Skip this one
Decent Hotel
reviews.text: The casino was fun with a nice variety of slot machines + live gaming. We didn't come home with more money than we took with us - but we had a good time, enjoyed ourselves and that is, afterall, what we really were looking for.

reviews.title: Great Stay
reviews.text: In the past I've stayed at the Stockman's Hotel/Casino in Elko because I enjoy the western "cowboy" ambiance. That is missing from the Red Lion, but I think the comfort and cleanliness and larger casino area are a good trade off.

reviews.title: Great time at Red Lion
reviews.text: Please do not stay here. The A/C didn't work, the toilet would not stop running unless you stuck your hand in the tank and pressed on the flap, and the sink won't stop dripping. When we called to complain about the A/C, they told us to turn it as low as we could and hope for the best. The hotel was not very clean. Please drive on by.

description: Catch the excitement at the Red Lion Hotel & Casino Elko in Elko, Nevada. The hotel is located just minutes from challenging and relaxing recreation found in the vast high desert, still alive with spirit of the old west mining history of northeastern Nevada. The Red Lion Hotel & Casino Elko features over 350 of the newest and best slot machines plus live poker, along with all of your favorite table games.Our recent $2 million hotel room upgrade provides you with complimentary wi-fi, Red Lion's signature plush Sealy pillowtop beds, contemporary furnishings with flat screen televisions, bathrooms with imported granite vanities, ceramic tile floors and curved shower rods in all 222 guest rooms.We also offer 24-hour casino action, live entertainment and a 24-hour full service restaurant with buffet. In addition to Aspen's, Elko's only fine dining restaurant, you'll find a state-of-the-art fitness center, outdoor seasonal pool, arcade, business center, Starbucks® Coffee, salon and massage services and a unique and memorable gift shop. Our first-class professional banquet and catering facilitiesare available for your meetings, parties or catered events.
